attributes.action: Call on the Indian Government to restore democratic rights to Jammu & Kashmir
attributes.additional_details: These steps contravene UN Security Council Resolution no. 47 and as a fellow Commonwealth country, the UK Government must urgently make representations to the Indian Government, directly, through the Commonwealth and through the UN to ensure safeguards against human rights abuses are immediately put in place; to seek restoration of Kashmir’s special status; to ensure demilitarisation, restoration of communications and to immediately allow full access to human rights observers.
attributes.background: The Indian Government, in revoking Article 370 and 35a of the constitution has stripped the people of Jammu & Kashmir of their long-settled political status and rights, deployed thousands of troops to a heavily militarised state and shut down communications.
